document.docAuthor: Döker, İsmail, Kazak, Cengiz & Karut, Kamil
document.masterDocTitle: A new species and two new records of the family Phytoseiidae (Acari: Mesostigmata) from Turkey

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species and two new records of the family Phytoseiidae (Acari: Mesostigmata) from Turkey

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined. Two females, near Karakaya dam lake, Kuluşağı town, Malatya, on
Tamarix
sp. ( Tamaricaceae ),
30 May 2014
; two males and two females, Silvan county, Diyarbakır, on
Tamarix
sp.,
16 August 2014
;
10 males
and
25 females
, near Seyhan dam lake, Adana city centre, on
Tamarix
sp.,
21 September 2014
. Specimens are deposited in the mite collection of the Acarology Laboratory, Department of Plant Protection, Çukurova University, Adana, Turkey .

Remarks. This new record is the first species of the genus
Paragigagnathus
for the Turkish fauna. Morphological characters and measurements of the Turkish specimens are very close to those of the original description and re-descriptions.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 1. Comparison of
Phytoseius ibrahimi Döker & Kazak
sp. nov.
with related species. (MD) Movable digit; (BtIV) Macro setae on basitarsus IV; (VAS) ventri-anal shield.
